title: Earth Science: Water Cycle and Systems

vocab.definition: The continuous movement of water through the environment
When liquid water changes into water vapor due to heat
When water vapor cools and changes back into liquid water
Water that falls from clouds as rain, snow, sleet, or hail
Water that soaks into the ground and is stored underground

teachingNotes: Use diagrams and hands-on models to demonstrate the water cycle. Connect the water cycle to weather patterns and emphasize its importance for all life on Earth.

truefalse.question: The water cycle only happens over oceans.

fillintheblank.question: When water vapor in the air cools down, it goes through ________.

shortanswer.question: How does water get back to the oceans after it falls as rain?
